column4: Can anyone tell me if there is a way to change the default mount point for my ipod? I have looked in the mtab and can't see anything glaringly obvious like with my ntfs partitions. Any idea?
paste me your /etc/fstab to http://www.pastebin.ca
and you say that the IPod is connected and mounted now?
pastebin me the output of "fdisk -l" and "mount".
im waiting on the paste :)
http://www.pastebin.ca/1364879
where is the IPod mounted now, /mnt/shared_ntfs ?
can you tell where your ipod is mounted as of right now?
by default it is /media/ipod but I will check

hah it doesn't appear there, which is odd it used to be /media/ipod. The only reason I want to mount it somewhere else is that stupid icon just makes me cry (im anal about having unwanted desktop icons gone)
is the ipod plugged in?
aye im charging it, and yes I was just playing pokemon emerald on it ;)
open up a terminal.
what'd it say?
i had a clean terminal up it didnt say anything I just got a gnome window that asked me what default action I wanted to take
did you "tail -f /var/log/messages" ?
no didnt even know that existed lol ill do it now
http://www.pastebin.ca/1364883 from my tail command thingy.
hold...
*holding*
now paste me a "sudo fdisk -l"
http://www.pastebin.ca/1364884
